intro: Calymenia prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate calymenia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in a low, spreading habit, often forming dense mats on the ground. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape, with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, producing a distinctive calyx that gives the plant its scientific name. Calymenia prostrata is often found in moist, sandy soils in coastal areas, where it thrives in saline environments.
